Class GameBoard

java.lang.Object
cpsc2150.extendedConnectX.models.GameBoard
public class GameBoard extends Object
this class holds the gameboard and its functions like checking for wins

  • Method Details

    • checkIfFree

      public boolean checkIfFree(int c)
      This function checks if a specified column on the gameBoard is availble for placing a token
      Parameters:
      c - an integer representing the column where the user wants to play their token (0 to maxColumn-1)
      Returns:
      Returns true if the selected column is availble, false otherwise

    • dropToken

      public void dropToken(char p, int c)
      This function places a token in a specific column, allowing it to drop until it collides with amother token
      Parameters:
      c - an integer, the column where the token is to be placed ( 0 <= c <= maxColumn-1)
      p - a character, either 'X' or 'O', which represents the player's token

    • checkForWin

      public boolean checkForWin(int c)
      checks if the last placed token wins the game, calls the other three check functions to do that
      Parameters:
      c - an integer, the column where the last token was dropped
      Returns:
      Returns true if the last move resulted in a player winning the game, otherwise false

    • checkTie

      public boolean checkTie()
      This function checks if the game has resulted in a tie. A Game is considered tie if there are no free board positions remaining. It returns true if the game is tied and false otherwise
      Returns:
      Returns true of the whole board is filled with 'X' or 'O' ( no empty places ) and no player has won, false otherwise

    • checkHorizWin

      public boolean checkHorizWin(BoardPosition pos, char p)
      This function checks if there are four identical pieces adjacent to the specified position in a horizontal direction
      Parameters:
      pos - a BoardPosition, the position where the most recent piece was played
      p - a character, representing either X or O depending on which playerâ€™s turn it is
      Returns:
      Returns true if there are four consecutive identical pieces (horizontal), false if not

      Parameters:
      pos - a BoardPosition, the position where the most recent piece was played
      p - a character, representing either X or O depending on which playerâ€™s turn it is
      Returns:
      Returns true if there are four consecutive identical pieces (vertically), false if not
